medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe eczema vaccinatum following exposure to a father who had received the smallpox vaccine.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4-5 days before hospital admission with increased itching and erythema on hands and face, and fever up to 39Â°C lasting for 2 days. On admission, blisters were observed on his hands spreading to arms and face.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of refractory atopic dermatitis and failure to thrive.
medical_history.family_history: Father has a history of inactive eczema. Sibling also reported a similar history.
medical_history.social_history: Father was in the US Army and had visited the family following his smallpox vaccination, engaging in routines that involved close contact with the patient.
